intro: Gentiana engleri, commonly known as the Chinese gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and features basal leaves that are lance-shaped with rough textures. Gentiana engleri thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. It is valued both for its ornamental beauty and its traditional uses in herbal medicine.
